field.name: Notes on screen widgets
field.definition: - the widget coordinate system is a left-handed system (+x to the right, +y up, +z into the screen) with the origin centered in the display (regardless of display size) - for widget component placement, all coordinates you define in the tag specifiy the object's placement prior to the application of any animation - all coordinates you define are local to that object - all text specific to objects in the screen comes from the screen's string list tag all of the string indices you may need to specify will refer to the screen's string list tag - a pane may contain either buttons OR a list OR a table-view, but never a combination of those (widget won't function correctly if you try that) - all text is centered unless you specify otherwise

field.name: Flags
field.definition: Set misc. screen behavior here

definition.entry: multiple panes are for list flavor items
Edit Jug Pts for Killing Jugger
Edit CTF Flag at Home to Score
Edit Assault Enemy Flag at Home to Score
Edit Indicator Players on Motion Sensor
Edit Indicator Invisible Players on Motion Sensor

field.name: Button Key
field.definition: The labels here are just a guide; the actual string used comes from the Nth position of this button key entry as found in the ui globals button key string list tag

field.name: Default Text Color
field.definition: Any ui elements that don't explicitly set a text color will use this color

field.name: Screen Text
field.definition: All text specific to this screen

field.name: Panes
field.definition: Define the screen's panes here (normal screens have 1 pane, tab-view screens have 2+ panes)

field.name: Button Definitions
field.definition: If the pane contains buttons, define them here

field.name: List Definition
field.definition: If the pane contains a list, define it here

field.name: UNUSED
field.definition: This is unused

field.name: OBSOLETE
field.definition: this is all obsolete

field.name: Value
field.definition: Enter the value in the box corresponding to the value type you specified above

field.name: Text Label
field.definition: This is text string associated with data when it has the value specified above. The string comes from the screen's string list tag.

field.name: OBSOLETE Table View Definition
field.definition: If the pane contains a table-view, define it here

field.name: Flavor Item Blocks
field.definition: Define additional flavor items here

definition.entry: ignore for list skin size calculation

field.name: NOTE on coordinate systems
field.definition: Halo y-axis=ui z-axis, and Halo z-axis=ui y-axis. As a convention, let's always place objects in the ui scenario such that they are facing in the '-y' direction, and the camera such that is is facing the '+y' direction. This way the ui animation for models (which gets applied to the camera) will always be consisitent.

field.name: UNUSED
field.definition: these are all OBSOLETE

field.name: OBSOLETE
field.definition: this is all obsolete

field.name: OBSOLETE
field.definition: this is all obsolete

field.name: Value
field.definition: Enter the value in the box corresponding to the value type you specified above

field.name: Text Label
field.definition: This is text string associated with data when it has the value specified above. The string comes from the screen's string list tag.

field.name: Shape Group
field.definition: If the screen is to have a shape group, specify it here (references group in user interface globals tag)

field.name: More Screen Parameters
field.definition: These are down here because they got added on later. Have a nice day.

field.name: Local strings
field.definition: String IDs here allow defining new string ids that are visible only to this screen.

field.name: Local bitmaps
field.definition: Bitmaps here allow adding a bitmap that's accessible in code for use in this screen.

field.name: LEVEL LOAD PROGRESS FIELDS
field.definition: These are used only for level load progress bitmaps

field.name: Mouse cursors
field.definition: The mouse cursor definition for this screen.
